page.title: 05 HISTORY OF BICTON (1)
page.content:
Bicton is a saxon name(Beocca's fort) but relics date from the palaeolithic age, particularly of Celts.Bicton was mentioned in 2 Domesday surveys.There was already a chapel;the lands were given to a Norman,Wm Portitor,together with the role of Keeper of Gate & Goal at Exeter Castle.(This wardenship was not given up until 1787).In 1229 Bicton passed to the Balistarius family who built a manor & church.From 1348-9 the Black Death led to the crown holding the land.From 1374 the estates grew under the Hampton,Sackville & finally Dennys families.Sir Tms Dennys' son (knighted by Eliz.1) built a tudor mansion. Since there was no heir,Bicton passed via daughter Anne to Sir Henry Rolle.(see Buildings:Bicton House)
By A.Kain & J.Ross
